intro: Thermopsis venosa, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces elongated seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Thermopsis venosa is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
